metadata.title: Word Formation - Single Sentences
metadata.description: Individual sentences with word transformations - 10 items per set

sentences.text: You'll have to RECOGNISE .......... him for all the work he's done over the years for local charities.
People .......... him for all the work he's done over the years for local charities.
She couldn't go out yesterday evening; she had to stay home and LOOK .......... her younger brothers and sisters.
I've finally found the report I've been SEARCH .......... for days.
He knows that some salesmen in his office SUCCEED .......... him because he isn't as successful as they are - but he doesn't worry too much about it.
That young lady is very CONSCIENCE .......... in her work, but not so careful about keeping her office tidy.
.......... plants are very difficult to grow in the UK, unless of course you have a hot house.
The news came as such a shock to them that they were both SPEECH ..........
I thought the whole evening was very ENJOY ..........
She didn't get the job because she just didn't have the right QUALIFY ..........
The line was ENGAGE .......... when she tried to phone her parents this morning, so she'll try again this afternoon.
'You'd like to speak to Mr Smith? That's .......... 342. I'm putting you through now.'
We got cut off because she was calling from a public .......... and she didn't have any more money to put in.
The storm was so bad last night that most of the telephone .......... in the area have been blown down.
You're playing a very DANGER .......... game.
There was a terrific EXPLODE .......... then the whole building collapsed like a pack of cards.
He said 'Good morning' in a most FRIEND .......... way.
My teacher COURAGE .......... me to take the examination.
This skirt is too short, so I must have it LONG ..........
A list will be sent on APPLY .......... to the manager.
Archaeologists located the walls of the old city at a DEEP .......... of several metres below the surface.
There were scenes of great EXCITE .......... when the results were announced.
When their case had been considered they must accept the DECIDE .......... of the court.
It should always be possible to make a COMPLAIN .......... against a government official.
There was no NECESSARY .......... for them to make two separate journeys.
This dog has been trained to be completely OBEY .......... to his master.
If the FEAR .......... of members were enough to prevent it, there would never be war.
To guarantee ADMIT .......... to the course you should apply very early.
Her suitcase seemed NECESSARY .......... heavy for such a short trip.
.......... has been destroyed by television.
The two political parties have OPPOSE .......... attitudes to the problem.
The boy's BEHAVE .......... improved as he grew older.
I made him APOLOGY .......... for being so rude.
Everybody in this NEIGHBOUR .......... works at the local factory.
There is a BELIEVE .......... that life exists on other planets.
Although his visit was EXPECT .........., we made him welcome.
Since he was so well trained, winning the race was COMPARE .......... easy.
I should like to hear a VARY .......... of opinions on this matter, not just one.
In his ANXIOUS .......... to make himself understood, he spoke slowly and very loudly.
.......... has working life he has been saving for a voyage round the world.
Her writing is very bad. I can't even read her SIGN ..........
All classes BEGIN .......... in January will end in April.
You should pack the glasses in a wooden box to avoid BREAK ..........
After most of the children had gone out, the house was COMPARE .......... quiet.
The cat examined the new kind of food SUSPECT ..........
Now she is earning money she feels more DEFEND ..........
The arrested man could give no EXPLAIN .......... of his actions.
It is really ORDINARY .......... that we two cousins living in the same town have never met before.
Nowadays when people want to protest about something they organise a DEMONSTRATE ..........
They meet and shout and wave banners and applaud their LEAD ..........
They .......... march long distances in all weathers.
If necessary, they are ready to fight for their BELIEVE ..........
If trouble breaks out, they may be arrested and even PRISON ..........
Yet it is .......... how much good all this really does.
They frequently MOBILE .......... the traffic as they march through the streets.
They cause trouble and .......... to pedestrians and Police.
With the result that people become .......... to their cause.
The results of the examination were very SATISFY ..........
The housing SHORT .......... in London and other great cities is one of the most pressing problems of modern times.
The number of HOME .......... people increases daily.
However, as yet there seems no satisfactory SOLVE ..........
The lack of USE .......... at rents which the ordinary person can afford is a disgrace to the nation.
The ERECT .......... of vast office blocks in our cities occupies valuable space that could be used for homes.
Such blocks are frequently left .......... and, as prices go up, they increase in value.
The MISERABLE .......... of those who have nowhere to live is ignored.
This is because to convert such buildings into flats for lower-paid workers would be PROFIT .......... for the property owners.
The only answer is for local people to form Housing ASSOCIATE .......... to help themselves.
And now they have all day in which to do the .......... things they always said they never had time to do before.
But the prospect of so much free time seems to discourage them COMPLETE ..........
This is because they are .......... for it.
If elderly people are really going to enjoy their leisure, then they must make proper PROVIDE .......... for it.
Whatever they are .......... in, now is the time to enjoy it.
.......... bird-watching, painting, whatever it may be, they must plan well in advance if they are going to make the best use of their time.
You/hear/about/Peter's/new/job?
sentences.answer: Have you heard about Peter's new job?

sentences.text: He/be/appoint/sales/manager/his/company
sentences.answer: He has been appointed sales manager of his company

sentences.text: He/be/not/lucky?
I/wish/I/have/good/job/like/his,/but/I/not/seem/have/any/luck
sentences.answer: I wish I had a good job like his, but I don't seem to have any luck

sentences.text: I/always/apply/jobs,/always/be/turn/down
sentences.answer: I'm always applying for jobs but I'm always being turned down

sentences.text: All/same/I/think/I/try/again./What/you/think?
sentences.answer: All the same I think I'll try again. What do you think?

sentences.text: You/advise/me/apply/job/your/firm?
sentences.answer: Would you advise me to apply for a job at your firm?

sentences.text: Write/let/me/know/what/you/think/be/best/thing/me/do
sentences.answer: Write and let me know what you think is the best thing for me to do

sentences.text: Recently .......... have become extremely worried about the world's population.
The problem is particularly acute in the .......... countries.
Unfortunately, the natural resources are becoming .......... for the support of the increasing population.
